name.japanese: モンブラン・クリケット

keyMoments.title: Mont Blanc Cricket's Debut
keyMoments.description: Cricket emerges from underwater diving and encounters the Straw Hat Pirates for the first time, shooting at them before collapsing from decompression sickness.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the key ally who will help the Straw Hats reach Sky Island and carries the legacy of Mont Blanc Noland.

keyMoments.title: Cricket Shares Noland's Story
keyMoments.description: Cricket reveals the tragic tale of his ancestor Mont Blanc Noland who discovered a city of gold but was executed as a liar.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Cricket's motivation and the emotional core of the Sky Island arc.

keyMoments.title: Cricket's Life Mission Revealed
keyMoments.description: Cricket explains that he has dedicated his life to diving near Jaya to find proof of the city of gold and restore his family's honor.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Cricket's determination and makes him a sympathetic character pursuing redemption.
keyMoments.quote: I'm going to prove that my ancestor was telling the truth!

keyMoments.title: Cricket Agrees to Help the Straw Hats
keyMoments.description: After learning of the crew's determination to reach Sky Island, Cricket decides to help them reach the Knock Up Stream.
keyMoments.significance: Solidifies the alliance between Cricket and the Straw Hats, setting in motion their journey to Sky Island.

bounties.reason: Former pirate with bounty from past activities

relationships.description: Cricket is a distant descendant of Mont Blanc Noland and carries the burden of his ancestor's tarnished reputation.

evolutionMoments.description: Cricket reveals his ancestry and his mission to prove Noland's story was true.

relationships.description: Masira is part of the Saruyama Alliance and helps Cricket in his search for the city of gold.

evolutionMoments.description: Masira is shown caring for Cricket when he collapses, demonstrating their bond.

relationships.description: Shoujou is part of the Saruyama Alliance and helps Cricket in his search for the city of gold.

evolutionMoments.description: Shoujou is shown caring for Cricket when he collapses, demonstrating their bond.

relationships.description: Cricket agrees to help Luffy and the Straw Hats reach Sky Island, recognizing their shared belief in dreams.

evolutionMoments.description: Cricket decides to help the Straw Hats after hearing about their determination to reach Sky Island.

reveals.information: Seeks to prove his ancestor was not a liar by finding evidence of the city of gold
Has a chestnut-shaped growth on his head, inherited from Noland
Suffers from decompression sickness due to extensive deep diving

name.japanese: モンブラン・ノーランド

keyMoments.title: Noland's Tragic Story Revealed
keyMoments.description: The legend of Mont Blanc Noland is told - how he discovered a city of gold but was executed as a liar when it couldn't be found upon his return with the king.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the historical tragedy that drives Cricket's quest and sets up the Sky Island arc's emotional stakes.
keyMoments.quote: The mountain of gold must have sunk into the sea!

keyMoments.title: Noland's Honesty Revealed
keyMoments.description: Cricket explains that Noland was known as an extremely honest man who never lied, making his execution as a 'liar' particularly tragic.
keyMoments.significance: Adds depth to Noland's character and makes his story more poignant.

statusHistory.deathDetails: Executed approximately 400 years before the current timeline for allegedly lying about the city of gold

relationships.description: Noland is Cricket's distant ancestor whose reputation Cricket seeks to restore.

evolutionMoments.description: Cricket reveals his ancestral connection to Noland.

reveals.information: Discovered a city of gold on Jaya Island 400 years ago
Executed by the king for allegedly lying about the city of gold
Known as an extremely honest man who never lied
Became known as 'Noland the Liar' in legend and children's books
